briefTitle: A Phase III Study of Abatacept in Patients With Rheumatoid Arthritis and an Inadequate Response to Methotrexate
officialTitle: A Phase III, Multi-center, Randomized, Double-blind, Placebo-controlled Study to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of Abatacept Administered Intravenously in Korean Subjects With Active Rheumatoid Arthritis While Receiving Methotrexate
summary: The purpose of the study is to demonstrate the clinical efficacy of abatacept (body-weight tiered dose approximating 10 mg/kg) compared with placebo on a background of methotrexate after 6 months (Day 169) of treatment in Korean patients with active rheumatoid arthritis and an inadequate clinical response to methotrexate

primaryOutcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Meeting the Criteria of the American College of Rheumatology for 20% Improvement (ACR20)
